Reviews.Title: “Pleasant very central”
Reviews.Author: James m
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently In Kensington park apartments and have stayed before. This is where I come when I travel to london from my home in Berlin. Must say that I have noticed lots of improvements in the Accomodation and cleanliness. So I am a very Happy customer Nice and warm Staff were Kind and a Good location to meet poeple in london.I will be back in the summer. Until then I would recommend. Regards James anthony

Reviews.Title: “Worst Place - Avoid at any cost”
Reviews.Author: SUNKHAT
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this place in Sep. Owner was on holiday and an old gentleman entertained me. The first room shown to me had termites on windows, drawers filled with garbage, uncleaned bins, smelly toilets and cobwebs around with rodents trap all around the room. Refusing to stay there, I was put in a different room in basement, which was slightly better with same uncleaned bins, stained bedsheets and a creepy/smelly corridor to enter. When I wanted to check out earlier, I was asked to pay money in full and in CASH, though he had my card details. I left after two days for a better place, but still having issues with charged placed against my card and working with card company. Pls avoid this place as it is not worth anything. Only location is good enough, everything else about this property is a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad!”
Reviews.Author: SchoJohn
Reviews.Content: I must admit that I was fearing the worst when I read all the terrible reviews of this place! I stayed here on 13th Sept just for a night, and it wasn't so bad. First of all, my fear was realized when I saw a hand scribbled phone number to call on the door. When I called it, there was no answer, but Roger (the temporary "owner") came to my aid within 5 minutes. The room was a bit of a lottery but, when Kate came to assist, I got a decent and large room in the basement. The room wasn't so clean and it was full of clutter, but it was large and decent enough. The bathroom was also cluttered but everything seemed to work OK. The location in Kensington couldn't be bettered.

Reviews.Title: “Also Kensington Court Aparthotel - DON'T BE FOOLED - HORRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: kryptogram
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here! Don't stay here! Don't stay here! Stay away at all costs. If this is the only line of my review you read, please listen to it. The owner is being purposely deceptive with his website, I'm sure to distance himself from the bad reviews here. I checked TripAdvisor and didn't see anything about Kensington Court Aparthotel. I booked the 2 bedroom place for 4 nights, at 200 pounds a night. We had been traveling for 3 weeks without being able to wash clothes, so that was one of the sellers for this place. I also liked the free wifi, the location and love quirky old places that don't have a hotel feel. However, I had a bad feeling about it right after I booked and found the reviews of Kensington Park Apartments and realized they were the same place. I tried to cancel my reservation, but I would have had to forfeit 1/2 the total, even though it was only 15 minutes later. We bit the bullet and went anyway, hoping for the best. When we arrived, the owner said he had upgraded us to a 2 bedroom 2 bath place instead. Room 13 was on the top floor, a flight of stairs above the elevator. The flight of stairs was narrow, but he had still managed to cram a mattress in it (see pictures).The website says there is a lift to all floors, an outright lie. He told us we could choose between that one and the one we had booked, a 2 bedroom 1 bath on the 1st floor, room 8 and room 13. Room 8 was tiny, 2 rooms with only enough room for a double bed and no walking space and a miniscule kitchen. We opted for room 13 and lugged our stuff up there. We were dismayed to find stained carpet, walls and furniture. There were holes in the walls and sheets, green globs on the wall and ceiling, flaking paint on the windows and a stain on the wall where someone had thrown a wet clothing item (a shirt?) which was still wedged between the wall and the desk. We were provided with 4 thin and tiny towels and never had replacements. The satellite TV didn't work, so we only had a few channels. The "Video Entry System" promised on the website is a mystery to me, is that a DVD player? The wifi didn't work and the owner wasn't available to ask. He basically disappeared after we paid, maybe to go spend our money. We tried to use the washer and it didn't spin, so after all that research to find a place with a washer, we were out of luck. The dryer didn't work either and we had to hang our clothes all around the apartment in order to dry them. We had a problem finding parking and called the owner about it. He was rude on the phone and told us to figure it out on our own. I mentioned that there were holes in the sheets and said, "Yes, that's because they're old." Really?! Then he proceeded to tell us what a great deal we were getting - 3 rooms! The owner has clearly spent his money on a slick website to lure people in, including using the names Kensington Park Apartments and Kensington Court Aparthotel. The pictures may have been accurate 20 years ago, but now are a parody of what's actually in the rooms. The reception area shown on the website is a complete fiction, borrowed from some other website, surely. The website promises maid service 2 times a week, but we never saw any signs a maid had been in to clean. The full kitchens promised are tiny. Two people can stand in the kitchen, but if one bends over, they're bumping into the other person. The topper to our 4 days of staying in this rathole firetrap was at checkout. We had called a cab and it was waiting at the curb. We hauled our stuff back down the tiny stairs, past the mattress to the elevator several times. The proprietor was at the desk, but never spoke to us, even when we couldn't get the elevator past the 1st floor on our final load. We were yelling progress reports up and down the stairs, so he surely heard us. I ran up the stairs for a final look through the pit and missed the owner shoving my husband out of the way while saying, "What did you do to my elevator?" - an accusation instead of help. Then he proceeded to verbally harrass my husband, who finally snapped and told him that this was the worst place we had stayed in five months of travel (true). The owner just said, "I don't want to hear bad things about my place." I'm sure that's all he hears! The saddest thing is that this could be a great place if it was cared for properly. It is like watching a beautiful old lady rot from cancer. This is a lovely old building in a great block. There are embassies all around. And it is most quiet, barring being on the flight path to Heathrow.

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel experience thus far”
Reviews.Author: statusquo81
Reviews.Content: We arrived early to ensure that we would get a full day of activities. Hotel management was lazy and struggled with the simplest paperwork, and it took almost an hour to check-in. Once inside the room, we almost turned back immediately, smell of mould, dampness and questionable overall cleanliness. As we were only meant to stay for a day or two, we said 'what the heck, let's give it ago, we won't be here much anyway". Boy did we regret this decision! Arriving back to the room late at night, we hear a dripping noise from the ceiling, water dripping down our bed. The entire ceiling was wet and at 4am we had to evacuate to a nearby hotel. The worse bit came later, an unapologetic hotel manager ordered a plumber to take care of this and offered us a new room. We decided it was not worth the effort, as we, despite being out looking for a new hotel room 4 in the morning, actually managed to find a reasonably priced and infinitely more accommodating alternative. Still, three days after we discovered that despite promising not to charge us for the room, he had done just that, citing that he thought that we had stayed there anyway (note that this is with water pouring down a bed). I would not wish my worse enemy this experience, and hence my WARNING!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely appalling hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller12319
Reviews.Content: -The cleanliness of this hotel was absolutely disgusting, the carpet smelt awful, stains and dust everywhere, I even found feces on the toilet seat. The hallways were dirty, baggage and random junk all over the place. Even the reception desk was cluttered and dusty. - The furniture had not been changed for a very long time, the tv was black and white. - I'm not sure what it was but it looked like wiring or something was coming out of one of the electrical sockets - extremely dangerous - The price was way way WAY too high for the quality of the stay. As I had booked online and had not seen the place before hand I could not get a refund upon entering and discovering this disaster of a hotel. -On top of all of this, the service was horrendous. Extremely rude man at the front desk, very unhelpful, sarcastic and unpleasant. The only good thing about this hotel was the location and THATS IT. I was dreading going back after my days out and honestly, it put a downer on my whole time in London.

Reviews.Title: “I'm not fussy, but....”
Reviews.Author: business_travellr63
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the front basement flat. Public areas were cluttered, dirty and had not been decorated (or cleaned) in decades. Room itself was disgusting - very grubby everywhere, rodent traps in the room, television & bathroom light did not work. Curtains would not fully close. The bed sheets & mattress were OK, but everything else was squalid. I stuck it out as I paid in advance, but I would actually not let my dog stay here. I have stayed in some cheap hotels, so I know what to expect for my money, but at Â£150 a night this was a joke, even for Kensington. Since leaving I have had 2 long showers, but i still feel grubby

Reviews.Title: “Fly-by-night fraudulent operation - do not risk giving them your money”
Reviews.Author: wxmxr
Reviews.Content: We pre-booked this hotel via lastminute (unfortunately I didn't read the other tripadvisor reviews first), pre-paying 4 nights. On arrival at the address of the â€˜hotelâ€™ - actually an apartment block with a single piece of paper stuck to the front door stating â€œFor arrivals, please ring mobile xxx or bell 7â€™. After several attempts to call the contact, a man picked up, and after we gave our name and asked him to come to the door, he said â€˜how much did you pay?â€™ and then 'we have no room for youâ€™ and hung up on us. We turned to lastminute to resolve the issue, who were helpful but had to rely on him booking us into a nearby hotel - which he half-did. He 'booked' us into another hotel around the corner (which was relayed to us via lastminute - we never spoke to this man again), but when we walked there and tried to check in, we were made to pay in full, again! He promised those hotel operators payment, but never showed up to pay them. Fortunately, we used American Express to dispute the charges and are not out of pocket (except for the phone calls and the wasted time), but this operator is clearly dishonest and a dangerous person to trust with your holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Lodgings, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: omafolabomi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for a week, between the 26th March and 2nd April. The apartments are poorly serviced, and are filthy in fact. After complaint, the proprietor was gracious enough to move us to a better room in the basement. The location is fantastic though, and the old gentleman was all right. Nonetheless, would not stay in that place again, frankly speaking.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, avoid, avoid”
Reviews.Author: TheFaqqer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this week, hoping that some of the older reviews here had led to some improvements.... Firstly, there was no-one there to check-in. I had to ring a mobile number and tell the man that I was waiting to check in, and then wait for him to turn up. One of the first things he said was to explain that the room was quite small, but I could upgrade if I wanted to, which didn't bode well. However, having paid over Â£100 a night for the room, I was not going to pay more. Room itself was OK, but smelled a bit musty. However, it wasn't clean - the carpet was stained and needed a good wash, and there were two mouse traps in the room, which again didn't fill me with confidence. Shower was good and hot, though, but the shower head only shot water straight out rather than down at all and wasn't adjustable. The toiletries were good (Gilchrist & Soames), but there wasn't enough toilet paper to last the week. Some of the plates had been put away dirty, and the sponge and drying up towel were dirty. I stay in London a lot, and you can get MUCH better for the same price or less - I'll not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay There”
Reviews.Author: HongKongVisitors
Reviews.Content: This hotel is disgusting, terrible and it is a disaster to stay there. It is dirty anf filthy. We would not dare tp sit on any chairs in the room. It was so dirty that we would not want to touch anything inside. Management was rude and tried to grab the money for the entire period we intended to stay fearing that we might want to check out once we have seen the conditions of the rooms. Unless you want to have a very unpleasant stay, you would want to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute disgrace”
Reviews.Author: maryjane11
Reviews.Content: As the travel agent who booked this I am absolutely disgusted with the lack of cleaniness and the attitude of the staff. I booked a 2 bedroom apartment for the sole use of one guest, who was then asked by reception to share with strangers. When questioned the manager asked if our guest thought he was jesus Christ!!! When I said this was unacceptable I asked the cancellation policy and was told there was no refund, it finished with the manager calling me a [--] and to p.... off!!! In over 20 years of travel experience I have never come across should abysmal language or behaviour

Reviews.Title: “Take Earlier Advice--DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelWW
Reviews.Content: There were so many problems with this property. First of all, the photos on the property's website are not what will greet you upon check-in. The apartment we had was threadbare with dirty and stained carpets, stained sofa, chairs, and headboard. The draperies were falling off the hooks in the bedroom and it needed a fresh coat of paint and DEEP cleaning . However, there was a nice table in the sitting room. There were no lights in the stairwell except for 2 table lamps placed on the floor on the first landing and the second on approximately the 3rd or 4th landing. My friends and I left for a few days and returned because we had already paid in advance and knew that we would be out of luck if we asked for a refund, so we decided to just make the best of it. Upon our return, we were directed to the same apartment with the instructions that if we wanted our sheets changed we were welcome to do it ourselves. We walked into the apartment and the odor of trash hit us--the full trash bags had been sitting in the kitchen the entire time along with all the dirty towels in the bathroom, Basically, it was in the exact condition as when we had checked out 4 days previously. Another problem was the $50 charge per night for 2 nights for a friend leaving her luggage with us. We felt this charge was just a way to "gouge" us for more money. The management felt that since the luggage was in our room (one small carry-on size suitcase) and that it had been opened and left on the floor, that the person had slept in our room. We completely understood paying for the extra person if that had been the case but she did not stay with us. She merely brought her suitcase to put some clothes in it that we had brought her from the States. Plus, the manager saw her walk in with the suitcase and never asked us about it until she came the next day to retrieve it. Then he tried to get her to pay the money. She refused and a big fuss ensued. We were prepared for this problem thanks to the previous posts concerning difficulties with the management. We tried a different approach and did our best to work it out with them. As a result, they reduced the charge to $50. However, it would not have mattered how much they would have reduced it, we will NEVER recommend or stay in this DUMP again. One final note: The morning after our arrival, an elderly couple were checking out because of the conditions of the accommodations. They and their daughter found it totally disgusting and asked for a refund. They went elsewhere to stay. I know that the management will disagree with this review as they have with all other negative reviews. Please disregard their thoughts--it is as I say-disgusting and dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Kensington Park Disgrace!”
Reviews.Author: Pmslater
Reviews.Content: I was thinking of staying here again, hoping it had improved. we stayed there in 2003 and it was filthy and the host really a cheat. It is such a great location but I am sorry to read it is still the same. i will never, ever stay there again. Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent and Inconsiderate”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In March I booked a reservation with this property for two different stays during the month of July. In early July, I sent a reconfirmation note to the property. I recieved nothing in reply. I then reviewed my statements and found they had never billed for the deposit. In a panic, of being caught in LON without a place to stay in the height of the season, I attempted 2 more times to get the property to respond to my notes, including send a "return reciept" e-mail. All to no avail. So, I had to scramble and find new accomodations 9 days prior to the start of our vacation. I find it unbelievable that this property thinks it is acceptable to ignore customer messages.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible G.M., Horrible Service, Horrible Apartments”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to stay here from 02nd June- 10th June, but when I reached the property, the apartment allotted to me was shabby & in the dark corner basement. I requested the G.M. (Ms. Lina) to change my room as this was very dingy & small with no natural light or even a sense of freshness. the carpets smelled & the toilets were disgusting. I kindly requested the g.m. to change my apartment as I knew that they had a few apartments vacant on higher floors, but she blatantly refused & said remarking racially that people from your part of the world should not stay here (I am from India). to which I obviously was very furious to face racism in a metropolitan city like London was very strange for me as I have lived in England previous to this visit for 7 years while I did my graduation, never had I been challenged with discrimination of this sort. I have travelled around the world & never have I seen anyone be so impolite & non-courteous to a customer. this property & its management need to be taught a lesson, so I would request all the people ever planning on staying, here think again & do the right thing !! P.S.- after my confrontation with the g.m. following the racist remark, I checked out immediately & they kept my deposit for the entire stay (GBP 760), which was not a very positive output either.

Reviews.Title: “Please do not book”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Please do not stay in this accommodation! I booked this apartment with a view to spending a few days in London with my family with Laterooms. It sounded nice and was in an ideal location for us so we booked. Initially I only wanted it for 2 days but on speaking to the reservations agent he told me the minimum stay was 3 nights-the agent asked me to wait on the line while he called the owner who agreed that we would be able to take it for 2 nights (thank god they record their calls!). The owner, Mr Bass, called me 1 week before our arrival to ask how many people were in our group-when I advise that we were 8 adults he told me that the apartment was too small, that I would have to pay for 3 nights, that nothing had been agreed with Laterooms. After much deliberation, I advised that I had received confirmation that he had agreed to our being there for 2 nights via email and that it was too late in the day to change. On arrival to the apartment, Mr Bass asked for payment in full before we had seen the room and advised that there were only 6 beds, the other 2 people could sleep on the floor (which was no better than a flea pit!) He denied talking to me previously and was still stating that we would pay for 3 nights. The accommodation was sub standard-not even a 1 star, the attitude of the owner unbelievably rude-He told us to go away to a bank, get our mickey mouse money and then pay him (his words). He also said that if we did not want the room then we should go, he was going to charge me anyway, AND that he was a multi millionnaire so money does not mean anything to him. I had to cancel my card as Laterooms were unable to help, but I am pleased to say that it was done in time so that he hasnt profited from me and that they have removed him from their website! (The Laterooms supervisor listened to the original calls and then caught him out!) Stay away from this place if you possibly can.

HotelInfo.Name: Kensington Park Apartments
HotelInfo.Address: 58 Kensington Court | Kensington, London W8 5DG, England
